verses.verse: Where has your beloved <WH1730> gone, <WH1980> you fairest <WH3303> among women? <WH802> Where has your beloved <WH1730> turned, <WH6437> that we may seek him with you? <WH1245> Beloved
My beloved <WH1730> has gone down <WH3381> to his garden, <WH1588> to the beds <WH6170> of spices, <WH1314> to feed <WH7462> in the gardens, <WH1588> and to gather <WH3950> lilies. <WH7799>
I am my beloved <WH1730>'s, and my beloved <WH1730> is mine. <WH7462> He browses among the lilies, <WH7799>
You are beautiful, <WH3303> my love, <WH7474> as Tirzah, <WH8656> lovely <WH5000> as Jerusalem, <WH3389> awesome <WH366> as an army with banners. <WH1713>

Turn away <WH5437> your eyes <WH5869> from me, <WH1992> for they have overcome <WH7292> me. <WH8181> Your hair is like a flock <WH5739> of goats, <WH5795> that lie <WH1570> along the side of Gilead. <WH1568>
Your teeth <WH8127> are like a flock <WH5739> of ewes, <WH7353> which have come up <WH5927> from the washing; <WH7367> of which every one has twins; <WH8382> none is bereaved among them. <WH7909>
Your temples <WH7541> are like a piece <WH6400> of a pomegranate <WH7416> behind <WH1157> your veil. <WH6777>
There are sixty <WH8346> queens, <WH4436> eighty <WH8084> concubines, <WH6370> and virgins <WH5959> without number. <WH4557>

My dove, <WH3123> my perfect <WH8535> one, <WH259> is unique. She is her mother <WH517>'s only daughter. <WH259> She is the favorite <WH1249> one of her who bore <WH3205> her. <WH1323> The daughters saw <WH7200> her, <WH833> and called her blessed; the queens <WH4436> and the concubines, <WH6370> and they praised her. <WH1984>
Who is she who looks forth <WH8259> as the morning, <WH7837> beautiful <WH3303> as the moon, <WH3842> clear <WH1249> as the sun, <WH2535> and awesome <WH366> as an army with banners? <WH1713>

I went down <WH3381> into the nut <WH93> tree grove, <WH1594> to see <WH7200> the green plants <WH3> of the valley, <WH5158> to see <WH7200> whether the vine <WH1612> budded, <WH5132> and the pomegranates <WH7416> were in flower. <WH5132>
Without realizing <WH3045> it, <WH5315> my desire set <WH7760> me with my royal people <WH5993>'s chariots. <WH4818> Friends

Return, <WH7725> return, <WH7725> Shulammite! <WH7759> Return, <WH7725> return, <WH7725> that we may gaze <WH2372> at you. <WH2372> Lover Why do you desire to gaze at the Shulammite, <WH7759> as at the dance <WH4246> of Mahanaim? <WH4264>
